Retrieve the bounding box of an OSM file

Source: R/get_bbox.R
osm_get_bbox.Rd

By default, returns a single sf::st_bbox if exactly one header bounding box is present. If no header box exists and calculate = TRUE, computes the true data bounding box via osmium fileinfo --extended (this reads the entire file and may be slow) and returns that. If multiple header boxes are found and return_bbox_list = FALSE, the function errors and asks you to retry with return_bbox_list = TRUE.

Usage

osm_get_bbox(
  input_path,
  calculate = FALSE,
  return_bbox_list = FALSE,
  echo_cmd = FALSE,
  echo = FALSE,
  spinner = FALSE,
  verbose = FALSE,
  progress = FALSE
)

Arguments

input_path

String. Path to an existing OSM file.

calculate

Logical(1). If TRUE, compute from data when no header bbox is present; otherwise error if missing. Defaults to FALSE.

return_bbox_list

Logical(1). If TRUE, return a list of sf::st_bbox objects (one per header box), even if only one is found. Defaults to FALSE.

echo_cmd

A logical. Whether to print the Osmium command generated by the function call to the screen. Defaults to FALSE.

echo

A logical. Whether to print the standard output and error generated by the Osmium call to the screen. Defaults to TRUE.

spinner

A logical. Whether to show a reassuring spinner while the Osmium call is being executed. Defaults to TRUE.

verbose

A logical. Whether to display detailed information on the running command. Defaults to FALSE.

progress

A logical. Whether to display a progress bar while running the command. Defaults to FALSE.

Value

  • If return_bbox_list = FALSE: a single sf::st_bbox.

  • If return_bbox_list = TRUE: a list of sf::st_bbox.

Examples

pbf <- system.file("extdata/cur.osm.pbf", package = "rosmium")

# header has one box
b1 <- osm_get_bbox(pbf)

# force computing true bbox (reads entire file)
b2 <- osm_get_bbox(pbf, calculate = TRUE)

# get a list of header boxes (even though there is only one)
L <- osm_get_bbox(pbf, return_bbox_list = TRUE)
